author: cbs8
title: UCLA Bruins and USC Trojans UNITE to Fund Innovative Cancer Research in the Heart of Downtown LA
text:
Special Joint Appearance by the UCLA & USC Marching Bands and Spirit Squads to Unite LA in support of cancer research at UCLA and USC's Comprehensive Cancer Centers
Los Angeles, CA 90071 (PRWEB) October 20, 2015
TOMORROW - THE SECOND ANNUAL
RIVALS UNITED FOR A KURE RALLY
THIS WEDNESDAY // OCTOBER 21, 2015 // 12:00 PM
Bruins and Trojans UNITE to Fund Innovative Cancer Research in the Heart of Downtown LA
Special Joint Appearance by the UCLA & USC Marching Bands and Spirit Squads
WHO:
UCLA Marching Band, USC Marching Band, UCLA Spirit Squad, USC Spirit Leaders, Joe Bruin (UCLA Mascot), Traveler (USC Live Horse Mascot), Paul McDonald (former USC Quarterback & Retired NFL Player) and Matt Stevens (former UCLA quarterback and Fox News Radio Analyst).
 WHAT:
 The Second Annual UCLA & USC Rivals United Rally
 WHERE:
 Outdoor Plaza Space of City National Plaza
 555 South Flower Street
 Los Angeles 90071
 WHEN:
 Wednesday, October 21
 11:45 am – Press Check-In
 12:00 pm – 12:45 pm Rare Joint Performance from Ucla & Usc Marching Bands
 12:10 pm - Joint Ucla/Usc Band B-roll & Photo Opportunity
 12:30 pm - Joint Ucla/Usc Spirit Squad B-roll & Photo Opportunity
 *** To confirm interest in covering this historic rally, please contact media liaison
 Kiki at kristenr(at)kureit(org)org or 949.212.4150 ***
Parking Available on the Street or Underground on Level A (Off Flower Street).
Validation Available at Press Check-In.
ABOUT RIVALS UNITED FOR A KURE
A City Divided becomes a City of Rivals United for a Kure UCLA and USC are Rivals United for a Kure. In it’s third year, Rivals United for a Kure, the largest fundraiser for Kure It Cancer Research, is a philanthropic outreach campaign designed to bring sports communities together to “Fight for a Kure”. Each year the funds raised during this campaign are divided equally and granted to UCLA Jonsson and USC Norris Comprehensive Cancer Centers for the immediate support of underfunded cancer research projects. Since inception, over $1,000,000 has been raised and granted into immediate use, translating the power of sportsmanship and collaboration into cancer research funding.
 //www.prweb.com/releases/2015/10/prweb13033779.htm
